body: The entire nba package is no longer functional. 'no data could be found'
@joewilaj @roclark   How long has this been?  How do these tasks get assigned? Wondering how long it will take them to fix this.
I just discovered this issue today. I had been using the package everyday for the past few months with with no error. I am not sure what needs to be fixed.
Would love an update on this
I am not sure if someone is going to fix it. I am also curious whether this GitHub page is maintained by who? @roclark @ajhodges
I also need this fixed. Perhaps a fork would be necessary if this isn't being maintained any more?

The div tag's id value changed on the teams pages.  Here is a diff with the fix for this issue:
 ```diff --git a/sportsipy/nba/nba_utils.py b/sportsipy/nba/nba_utils.py
index 919edc4..0dd1209 100644
--- a/sportsipy/nba/nba_utils.py
+++ b/sportsipy/nba/nba_utils.py
@@ -82,8 +82,8 @@ def _retrieve_all_teams(year, season_file=None):
            utils._url_exists(SEASON_PAGE_URL % str(int(year) - 1)):
             year = str(int(year) - 1)
     doc = utils._pull_page(SEASON_PAGE_URL % year, season_file)
-    teams_list = utils._get_stats_table(doc, 'div#all_team-stats-base')
-    opp_teams_list = utils._get_stats_table(doc, 'div#all_opponent-stats-base')
+    teams_list = utils._get_stats_table(doc, 'div#div_confs_standings_E')
+    opp_teams_list = utils._get_stats_table(doc, 'div#div_confs_standings_W')
 
     if not teams_list and not opp_teams_list:
         utils._no_data_found()
```
When I try an push a new branch with the fix to the repository, I get this message:
```git push origin fix_teams_div_id 
ERROR: Permission to roclark/sportsipy.git denied to MarkGannon.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
```
Thanks @MarkGannon! I had a feeling it was some simple HTML change on the source but CBA at the time. Appreciate it!

Will anyone push the changes? I tried with getting a schedule for every team 
teams = Teams()
for team in teams:
    schedule = team.schedule()  # Returns a Schedule instance for each team
    # Returns a Pandas DataFrame of all metrics for all game Boxscores for
    # a season.
    df = team.schedule.dataframe_extended
    
  and I also get the same error

Hey everyone, I know this is a late response but I finally got some time to take a look at this. The table ID's on the website changed and it was unable to pull any information as many of you found. I was able to create a patch and pushed PR #644 which should resolve the issues here. Targeting that branch, I am now able to run the following code:

```python
from sportsipy.nba.teams import Teams

teams = Teams()
for team in teams:
    print(team.name, team.abbreviation)
```

Which has the following output

```
Milwaukee Bucks MIL
Brooklyn Nets BRK
Washington Wizards WAS
Utah Jazz UTA
Portland Trail Blazers POR
Indiana Pacers IND
Phoenix Suns PHO
Denver Nuggets DEN
New Orleans Pelicans NOP
Los Angeles Clippers LAC
Sacramento Kings SAC
Golden State Warriors GSW
Atlanta Hawks ATL
Philadelphia 76ers PHI
Memphis Grizzlies MEM
Boston Celtics BOS
Dallas Mavericks DAL
Minnesota Timberwolves MIN
Toronto Raptors TOR
San Antonio Spurs SAS
Chicago Bulls CHI
Los Angeles Lakers LAL
Charlotte Hornets CHO
Houston Rockets HOU
Miami Heat MIA
New York Knicks NYK
Detroit Pistons DET
Oklahoma City Thunder OKC
Orlando Magic ORL
Cleveland Cavaliers CLE
```

Thanks for the patience and the debugging efforts!
Hey @roclark  thanks again for pulling this together! I've reinstalled the package and I'm unfortunately running into the same issue. Is there another version I should be using?
